Recent updates View all (12)

July 24

Patch 1.2.0 - Scrolls, Forger and more!

Hey Townies!

Today is the day. We are releasing patch 1.2.0. This is a big patch, and will include a ton of new features. We are adding in a new role called the Forger, the Scroll system, a new pirate themed bundle, a new Refer-A-Friend system, new pets, new maps, new skins, new houses, fixes to Elo, we added Rainbow mode to the Chaos games, and did some UI reworking. We will be bringing down the server soon, and it will take at least 2 hours to get the patch live! Please be patient while we patch.

Details below!

Features:
New Refer a Friend system!
* Check out this thread for more info: http://steamcommunity.com/games/334230/announcements/detail/97176518923833544

Elo Fixes
* Elo you gain/lose is now based on the role you were in game.

Forger
* The Forger is a new Mafia deception role which can replace the last will of a person. The next time you see a last will, there's a chance you can't trust it!


Scroll System
* The scroll system will allow you to increase you chance of being the role you want to be! NOTE: Scrolls do not work in Ranked play.


Boatload of Swag Starter Pack
* This Pirate themed starter pack has everything you need as a new player or a grizzled veteran.


New Characters
* Grim Reaper is the reward for successfully referring 5 friends.

* Forger skin (see Forger above)

New Pets
* Friend, Not Food is the reward for successfully referring 3 friends.

* XJ-0462 is the cutest robot around!


New Maps
* Land Before Time


New Houses
* No Trespassing



New Lobby Icon
* The Grim icon is the reward for successfully referring 2 friends.


Rainbow Mode
* A chaos game type that has a pretty role list!

New Login UI
* The new Login screen has it's own creepy music and new artwork!

27 comments Read more

July 24

New Refer-A-Friend System

Hello Townies,

With patch 1.2.0 comes the new (and improved) Refer-A-Friend System.

Why was Refer-A-Friend changed?
The old RAF system seems to only greatly benefit the YouTubers and Twitch streamers (Our top 10 accounts with the most friends referred are Markiplier, ChilledChaos, Minx etc...). We want to introduce a system where our average users can obtain the highest tier rewards by inviting a few of their friends to play Town of Salem!

The NEW RAF Rewards
1 Friend Referred = 100 Town Points
2 Friends Referred = 100 Town Points + Lobby Icon

3 Friends Referred = 100 Town Points + Fish Pet


4 Friends Referred = 100 Town Points
5 Friends Referred = 100 Town Points + Grim Reaper Character



How To Refer-A-Friend
When creating an account on the forums, Steam or Facebook there is an optional input field to specify a friend to refer. Simply put their username in the box. For Steam users the friend referred will immediately receive their RAF rewards. For browser users it will require purchasing any amount of Town Points from the shop or purchasing cash only items like the "Boat Load Of Swag" bundle.

Why the in-app purchase requirement for RAF validation?
The old Refer-A-Friend system would require users to play at least 10 games before the RAF reward would be given. This was to help prevent users from making multiple accounts and referring themselves. With the new reward system being much more enticing we struggled to come up with a solution to prevent users from making alternate accounts and AFKing or Botting through games only to cheat the RAF system. We do not want the RAF system to impact the quality of games by motivating that kind of behavior. With the requirement of being a Steam user or making an in-app purchase there is no longer a motivation for users to make alternate accounts or AFK through games to collect RAF rewards.

All users with successfully referred friends will be auto granted the items on patch day.

14 comments Read more

About This Game

Purchasing this game on Steam comes with $5 worth of Town Points (in-game currency)

Town of Salem is a fresh innovation on the classic party games Mafia and Werewolf. It is a game of murder, accusations, deceit and mob hysteria.

How To Play

The game ranges from 7 to 15 players. These players are randomly divided into alignments - Town, Mafia, Serial Killers, Arsonists and Neutrals. If you are a Town member (the good guys) you must track down the Mafia and other villains before they kill you. The catch? You don't know who is a Town member and who is a villain.

If you are an evil role, such as a Serial Killer, you secretly murder town members in the veil of night and try to avoid getting caught.

Roles

Town of Salem has 31 unique roles ensuring a different experience each time you play.

Before a game starts, players are put into a lobby where the host can select what roles will be in the game. Players are then assigned roles at random from the list of chosen roles. Players have an in-game role card that explains their role's abilities and alignments. For an in-depth look at the abilities of each role please visit: www.blankmediagames.com/roles

Game Phases

Night

The night phase is when most roles use their abilities. For example, Serial Killers stealthily murder people, Doctors heal people who are attacked, and Sheriffs interrogate people for suspicious activity.

Day

The day phase allows the Town members to discuss who they suspect of being an evil role. Once the voting phase starts a majority vote from the town will put someone on trial.

Defense

The defense phase is when you plead your innocence to the town. Have a convincing story or find yourself facing the gallows!

Judgement

During this phase the town will vote on the fate of the defendant. Players can vote guilty, innocent or abstain. If there are more guilty votes than innocent votes the defendant is sentenced to death by hanging!

Customization

Players are able to choose their own map (town setting), character, pet, lobby icon, death animation, house and a custom name. The other players in the game will see your selections. There are currently 10 maps, 29 characters, 20 pets, 5 death animations and 20 houses to choose from.

Achievements

There are currently over 220 unique achievements in the game. Earning achievements will grant various in-game items (however the items for donation rewards are exclusive to Kickstarter).
